text: George Kingsley Zipf (;. January 7, 1902 â€“ September 25, 1950), was an American scientist in the fields of linguistics, philology, mathematics and statistics. He came up with a law of word frequency in languages which bears his name. == References == Category:Scientists from Illinois Category:1902 births Category:1950 deaths Category:Harvard University alumni
